name: Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc.
description: Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc. is a bank holding company based in Western New York. Established in 1891, the company operates through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Lake Shore Savings Bank, which provides a range of financial services to individuals and businesses in the region. Lake Shore Savings Bank offers traditional banking products such as savings accounts, checking accounts, and loans, including personal loans, mortgages, and commercial lending. The bank is committed to serving its local communities and providing personalized service, with a focus on building long-term relationships with its customers. In addition to traditional banking services, Lake Shore Bancorp also offers online banking solutions and investment services, allowing customers to manage their finances conveniently. The company prides itself on its strong community involvement, supporting local organizations and initiatives. As a publicly traded company, Lake Shore Bancorp continues to enhance its service offerings and growth strategies to meet the evolving needs of its customers while maintaining a focus on financial stability and customer satisfaction.

seo.meta_title: Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc. | Community Banking Solutions
seo.meta_description: Discover Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc., a community bank in Western New York providing personalized banking and investment services. Explore our offerings and community involvement.

faq.question: What services does Lake Shore Bancorp offer?
faq.answer: Lake Shore Bancorp offers banking services such as savings accounts, checking accounts, mortgages, personal loans, and commercial lending, as well as investment services.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Lake Shore Bancorp?
faq.answer: Daniel P. Reininga is the CEO of Lake Shore Bancorp, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Lake Shore Bancorp headquartered?
faq.answer: Lake Shore Bancorp is headquartered in Lakewood, New York, USA.

faq.question: When was Lake Shore Bancorp founded?
faq.answer: Lake Shore Bancorp was founded in 1891.
